intro: Pseudognaphalium nubicola, commonly known as the cloudland everlasting, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color, surrounded by pale green to white bracts. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it well adapted to harsh environmental conditions. The plant is often used in local horticulture for its ornamental value and resilience.
